wikipedia_page.main: William Thomas Porter, S.M.A.  (14 May 1887 –  16 June 1966) was an English Roman Catholic missionary priest, bishop and archbishop, who served as Vicar Apostolic of Gold Coast and later  Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Cape Coast in present-day Ghana. He was appointed vicar apostolic (as well as titular bishop of Urusi) on 25 April 1933 and archbishop on 18 Apr 1950. He retired as archbishop on 15 May 1959.

response: *The Right Reverend William Thomas Porter, , Roman Catholic Bishop of the Gold Coast.

It was founded on 29 January 1952 by Archbishop William Thomas Porter of the Society of African Missions.  At the time of the founding, Porter was then vicar apostolic and later Archbishop of Cape Coast.
